Name: The Feynman Lectures on Physics, Vol. 3

ReviewList.Text: Just a quick note on the Millennium edition of the Feynman lectures box set: It does not contain Tips on physics, however, they are working on a revised edition of Tips on physics with over 900 extra pages that should be done by the end of 2011. It is likely to be released both separately and in a box set with the millennium edition books.

This version is printed on glossy paper, so it is not easy to eyes, the print also is lighter compared with  my friend's older version. So if you want to read it instead of just collecting it, you perhaps should buy version from 2005 or 1971.

I bought these books for my son as a present for good grades- he asked for them. They seemed expensive to me but how many kids want physics books? These are nice solid books and I expect he'll have them for the rest of his life. They have a feel and a heft that seems to convey the essence of the subject. He's happy and all I can say for myself is the day these books arrived he opened the box took them out and looked at them, then he walked over and without a word gave me a hug. Yes, I love this purchase.

Of all the physics textbooks currently available on the market, this one seems to be the best at explaining phenomena and challenging the reader to think creatively about the material. The only gripe I can possibly give about this series is that there is a distinct lack of problem sets, which can lead to more artistic studying rather than actually putting the legwork into understanding physics. This can be solved by purchasing one of the many books out there that are almost entirely problems, and using them to help you keep up with Feynman's lectures.

Freshman lectures by one of the great physicist of all times. Feynman's teaching style is just incredible. He gives new perspectives to classical ideas in physics. This book is for anyone who has interests in science or who loves nature and wants to learn more about it.

Feynman's books are as close as one can get to sitting in class with a scientific genius.  These books are worth every penny.  Furthermore, I find them challenging but not difficult to read, and I am not a physicist.

I read the entire book back in college.  The approach to explaining quantum mechanics was so different from the other books I read back then.  The derivation of the rotation matrices,  the discussion of symmetry and  superconductivity, among others, were simply breathtaking.  Definitely a  classic.

This is a classic series of books that needs no introduction.  Unless you need these in print, you can go to feynmanlectures dot info and access them for free.  As long as you have a modern browser the print and equations look really good and you can increase their size.  You can also view the exercises and answers as well as stories and a lot of other information.

I was given a 1960's edition of this book several years ago and did not pick it up until this summer (not the commemorative edition).  I am amazed at how clearly written this book is.  The arguments and equations are simple to follow, and usually you do not need to verify the calculations but if you do, there's plenty of margin space to do so, which I really appreciate.  Feynman does not get bogged down in details.  But he does not omit important points.  And there is no shortage of illustrations.  If you want to get a "feel" for quantum theory, then this is the book for you.  Feynman is quoted as having said that no one truly understands quantum mechanics.  That's probably true but Feynman seems to know about it more than most authors.  If I were stuck on a desert island, this would be one of the quantum books I would want to have with me.
Believe it or not, my son requested these for his birthday present! He is far smarter than me! He didn't think he was going to get them and was so excited when he opened them!

Feynman was apart of a committee back in the day where they would review these textbooks for elementary and high schools and recommend which books the school should get. Feynman spent lots of his time reading through 300 hundred pounds of textbooks (first for math, then for science). He realized that these 'new' generation of books aren't good for the students. They lacked how and why. They included fake or useless practical applications. Description was lacking because the textbooks were made by people who know nothing on the subject. Finally this book was created based off his lectures at caltech and it doesn't lack anything that the textbooks he reviewed did. It's still solid with accurate information all these years, although its accurate it necessary isn't updated.

Refreshing take on the subject. He derives all of freshman and sophomore physics from scratch and uses very intuitive arguments to do so. The math prerequisite isn't that much either: calculus, elementary linear algebra, and elementary differential equations. One thing I might add is this would be a very difficult first exposure without the help of a professor. There are some parts that seem a little too wordy at times and others that seem as though he is showing off at how little you need to arrive at a fundamental result. Don't be fooled, this isn't Feynman's first rodeo. Overall a great series of lectures. Bravo prof feynman
Classic Series. Feynman does such a nice job explaining physics. Just a really smart guy that took teaching seriously and thus was really good at it.
Many teachers were brought up by the "Feynman School" of Physics. This book is the ultimate source & treasure for my son. Thank you, Amazon!
If only I had a year to read it. It does read like a novel more than a textbook.

I picked this up from Amazon about a year ago, and have so far read all of Volume 1 and about half of Volume 2.  It is a rare pleasure to find a text on a hard science that is this well written and comprehensible.  The treatment on special relativity is the most concise and clear explanation I have read.  Some familiarity with basic calculus and advanced algebra will help, but not necessary to enjoy Professor Feynman's prose.  Highly recommended.

Feynman's repution as a teacher is well known and richly deserved. These books are an eloquent testiment to that reputation.He is always lucid,even when dealing with concepts so abstract they have presented a mystery to some of the great minds of science and mathematics. It is a sound introduction  to physics and also inspirational as it conveys the excitement that can be found in scientific inquiry.

Reviewing the Feynman Lectures on Physics seems a little dull, as it's probably the most - well - reviewed All-Around Physics book. Every Physicist should have a copy of this beauty, for it brings a different way to look at the world. If there's anything Richard Feynman still thrives up to this day, is teaching Physics and making people love it, and this set of books is a big part of that.

I am still in the process of reading this trilogy and I find myself not being able to put these books down, but we are talking about one of the greatest teachers of all time(in my opinion) if you like Feynman, you will love these books. But keep in mind, I am very pro biased to Mr Feynman as he is one of my few hero's, and I don't have many.
everyone has it. everyone loves it. read it.

An amazing set of books by an amazing author. Not only was Feynman a genius physicist, but he was an excellent teacher. As long as you know basic probability, trigonometry, and calculus (just the basics) you're good to go. Highly recommended.

I love reading this book. I find myself writing on the sides of the pages leaving notes about something random. This book is a must have for everyone that wants to learn about the physical world. This version of the book is great.

Richard Feynman is unbeatable in explaining physics in a concise and understandable way. Although these lectures are almost "vintage" they are a must-have for anyone occupied with physics in a professional way.

Glossy paper. I most enjoyed the original 10 volume set. The true volume collection is not as thorough because it leaves out some topics. Still, an excellent reference that can be reviewed on selected topics.

My daughter is a environmental lawyer, and her husband is a Physics Professor, so this was the perfect gift.  He was very gratified to finally have a copy for himself.  This is a quality edition, too.
This has been one of the most helpful reference packages I've ever purchased. It's great if you are just learning Physics or if you already understand Physics but need an occasional reference.
A perfect companion forto help you along in your modern physics class. Easy to understand, the material is still relevant, and Feyman is a great science writer who will make you laugh.
Great introduction into quantum mechanics. Feynman give a simple introduction into a complex topic and he shows the relation to the daily life. Readable for everybody.
Lectures of physics....i have looked for this collection...for some time....good to have tree similar books in my library and it's thee reference of a lot of physics
Feynman's lectures are very good.  He can really communicate complex subject very well.  This is a must read for anyone who wants to know how it all works.
A quality collection of Feynman lectures.  Binding and printing are first class.  I bought them  for my son, an avid Feynman student.  He loved them.
This series explains phenomena in very fundamental ways so one can understand the basic mechanism of how these things work.  I recommend it.
I am very pleased with this edition of the Feynman Lectures on physics. Perfect for the Feynman enthusiast. Great for supplemental learning.
Bought this for my fiance. He loves it, he's been wanting the whole series for a long time. I am happy with the condition of the book.
My son requested 2 of Feynman's books as a Christmas gift.  He was thrilled to receive the whole set.  Good price and fast delivery.
The quality of the books is excellent.  They appear to be very durable.  The permanent case will be great protection for the books.
This is the version I want to collect even when I become a professor later. Very classic and best introduce the physical pictures.
Excellent, excellent, excellent. Dr. Feynman had a gift, and it clearly showed at the Investigation of the Challenger Explosion.
Great book, what would you expect from Richard Feynman? It's superbly well written and his brilliance makes any subject easy
An essential book by its content and unique for the quality of its edition. A perfect gift for physics or even  maths lovers
I think it is a great product and very usefull for physists generally not only for students. I am absolutely satisfied!!
Awesome! This should be a textbook in schools. Though I would like it to be updated to reflect latest findings.
Invest in these books you will use them forever. purchased in 1999 still go back to this. Feynman is priceless.
Bought this as a gift for a physicist friend who had said he really wanted a set. He is extremely pleased.
I was afraid the type might be too small, but it is just fine. A pleasure to own this collection.
Superb edition of a timeless classic. Worth having even if you've read other editions before.
Well written in a very readable style.  These lectures are legendary and with good reason.
This was a gift for my daughter who is working toward her PhD in Physics. She loves it!
The Books of Mr. Neyman is the most complete study of Physics

The books were brand new and I am enjoying them so much. Reading physics explained by my most favorite of all physicists is delight and I can hear Feynman's voice through the text. The style of the text is so great and Feynman gives you the perspective of the problem before start explaining the technicality of the terms and concepts and it inspires me to read on. Great book and worth the money.
It is a classic. It is as writing about Shakespeare. Simply, a classic.
Richard Feynman is one of the most talented quantum physicists ever.
Much appreciated gift by our family scholar and  college professor.
This was a Christmas gift for myself.  I love it . . .

Love these hardbound books. These are the complete Undergraduate lectures from the master himself. Very nice to have as an addition to your library and would make a nice present for an admirer of Physics, Feynman, or just an academic that appreciates beautiful texts.
Wish the lectures were as cost effective to own!
The Feynman Lectures are amazing as expected.
The definitive work by the master.
One of the best books I ever read!
a classic and great guide
wonderful. stimulating.
Truly Magnificient
Great series !
A Classic !

I really like Feynman's creative writing in physics. However, the sleeve containing all 3 volumes was noticeably damaged, and I bought this book new. What a shame, at least all the books were is perfect condition.
Physics Bible!  Great pick for any and all physic majors or if you need more info than what your being taught
After more than 2 months, I received the books.
I am satisfied
Excellent!!

Thank you Amazon for giving us the opportunity to own this beautiful set of Feynman's lectures. WOW! I never dreamed I would ever be able to have his lectures. You will not be disappointed with this set.
Feynman makes it easy to really understand. It is a  shame that the lectures were not video recorded, but that was not possible 50 years ago.
Nice set of books, worth every penny! A must for up and coming in the physics world. Looks good sitting on my desk.
great  package, a lifetime worth of reading.
excelent

The packaging and condition of the product was great and it's everything as promised. Feynman explains concepts in a unique way and I recommend these lectures to any person with an interest in physics or the world in general.
The Feynman Lectures on Physics  boxed set was exactly  as described in the ad and was sent out promptly. It is a gift so I can't comment on the contents.

it will be an excellent high school text book expecially for those wh oare preparing for the Ap physics C or those who loves physics and are willing to place themselves in  advance standards. i would recommand that book for all high school seniors and first year college students who major or intend to major in science or engineering since most of today's "lectures" are generally mediocre. P.S. u have to reread each chapter for at least 2 times even though u think u understand it
OUTSTANDING "PHYSICS BIBLE" NOT COMMON TO FIND IN THE MARKETPLACE. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED TO ANYONE INTERESTED IN SERIOUS PHYSICS AT GRADUATE & POSTGRADUATE LEVELS.
this will come in handy.  i was thinking of souping up the accelerator on my bicycle. i'm going to the other side of the big bang, just before it happened.

It is a Chrsitmas present so I did not open the books... And I am not sure I would understand anyway. But the books look great, the price was ok compared to other sellers and the delivery was quick and reliable as usual with Amazon. Recommended!
